image.altText: A crowd safety officer looks over the crowd at Summernats 2024 in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Two security guards who punched patrons in a brawl at Summernats have escaped jail time, with a judge labelling the situation as "highly volatile".

title.children: Summernats guards avoid jail after punching patrons in festival brawl

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into Canberra's troubled MyWay+ ticketing system has been told the personal details of public transport users were likely accessible on the internet before and after its launch.

title.children: Inquiry into botched MyWay+ rollout hears personal details were accessible online

image.altText: A woman with curly red hair sits in front of a bookshelf smiling.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell vows to stay the course amid sustained pressure on her leadership, while blasting her most vocal critics for using her gender as a tactic to undermine her.

title.children: ANU vice-chancellor says leadership criticisms 'personal' and 'absolutely' driven by gender

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A former public servant accused of paying a young relative hundreds of dollars to send him indecent images of herself has been denied bail in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Canberra court hears man coerced young relative to send indecent images

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: The trial of a man accused of attempting to import methamphetamine from America through the mail hears allegations he planned to organise the shipment on the dark web.

title.children: Man accused of drug importation ordered ice on 'dark web', court hears

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man and woman are banned from owning a pet for 10 years after pleading guilty to animal cruelty.

title.children: Canberra pair banned from owning a pet after emaciated dog put down

image.altText: Trish cuts some wood using a tool, wearing ear muffs, a mask and high-vis.

props.synopsis: When Sunita Kotnala first came to Canberra, there was no women's shed, something she felt was needed. Now she helps other women gain the confidence to use power tools and make things with their hands.

title.children: Trish used to be 'petrified' of using power saws. Now she teaches woodworking

image.altText: A red rally car turning a corner with dust flying out the back.

props.synopsis: Motorsport fans lap up the first round of the Australian Rally Championship held in the forests surrounding Canberra, with Lewis Bates securing victory on home turf for the first time.

title.children: Rally driving moves up a gear as interest in motorsports surges

image.altText: Grey, blue, pink and yellow egg cartons sit for sale on a shelf

props.synopsis: After making the price of eggs a key election issue, Donald Trump is importing them from as far away as Türkiye and South Korea to tackle continuing shortages.

title.children: Donald Trump is shopping for hundreds of millions of eggs

image.altText: A high-up shot of Parramatta's CBD during a cloudy wet day

props.synopsis: A mass of tropical air forecast to engulf Australia's east coast is set to bring more days of uncomfortable humidity alongside the chance of flooding rains.

title.children: Unbearable humidity forecast to trigger rain for Queensland and NSW

image.altText: Linden Hall runs ahead of two other competitors.

props.synopsis: Three-time Australian Olympian Linden Hall is concerned by World Athletics proposing the introduction of chromosome testing for female athletes at future events.

title.children: 'Really tricky space': Aussie Olympian worried by chromosome testing proposal

image.altText: Hamdan Ballal is released from a police station in the West Bank

props.synopsis: The director said he was arrested for filming an attack on his neighbour's house in the village Susiya.

title.children: Oscar-winning Palestinian director released after arrest in West Bank

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: End-to-end encrypted messaging app Signal is secure for everyday use but shouldn't be used by government officials to have conversations regarding national security, cyber security experts say.

title.children: Signal is 'as safe as messaging apps get', but not for national security

image.altText: A man in a suit with a red tie speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Multiple times in his quest to become premier, David Crisafulli told voters a new stadium wasn't in his plans — yesterday, he announced one that will cost more than $3 billion.

title.children: David Crisafulli has broken a promise, but will anyone care in the long run?

image.altText: A view of the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: Whyalla steelworks administrator KordaMentha says it has identified up to a dozen "interested parties" as it seeks to secure a sale of the business by the end of the year, and has also praised the "MacGyver-like" ingenuity of local workers contending with a plant in need of repair.

title.children: Whyalla's 'MacGyver-like' steelworkers praised as site on track for sale

image.altText: A man in handcuffs escorted by police.

props.synopsis: Seven men connected to an organised crime group have been arrested following an investigation into the theft of 1.4 tonnes of tobacco in Sydney.

title.children: Stolen tobacco worth tens of millions as seven arrested in Sydney raids

image.altText: Five staff members of a resort stand on the beach and wave happily with their left hands

props.synopsis: Yes, there is yet another streaming service arriving on our shores. But things are a little different with this one, and it could up-end the Australian TV landscape.

title.children: HBO's streaming service is coming to Australia. It could change everything

props.synopsis: The Albanese government has delivered its final budget ahead of an election in May, with a fresh new round of tax cuts the major offer. Find out who else is set to benefit and who may miss out.

title.children: Find out if you're among the budget's winners or losers

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A small grey shark with yellowish spots along its body viewed from above against a black background.

props.synopsis: Sharks were thought to be silent, but scientists have recorded a New Zealand species making a clicking noise.

title.children: Sharks recorded making sounds underwater for the first time

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds his arms out while speaking at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The forecasts in the federal budget paint a rosy picture of the future, claiming the mythical "soft landing" is "increasingly likely" for Australia's economy.

title.children: Is Australia's economy on track for a 'soft landing'? The budget papers say it is

image.altText: A sign outside Alcoa's Kwinana alumina refinery next to a road leading into the industrial buildings

props.synopsis: Aluminium giant Alcoa is fined $400,000 over an incident where workers and school students were burned by an "uncontrolled discharge of hot caustic solution" at its Kwinana refinery in WA.

title.children: Alcoa fined over 'very serious' chemical burns to work experience students

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: South Australians living with a disability have reportedly had their hands shackled with rope, their wheelchair tyres punctured and food withheld by family members and carers, the state's domestic violence royal commission has heard.

title.children: People living with disability subjected to 'terrible things', DV royal commission hears

image.altText: A wall of portraits with one removed

props.synopsis: It's unknown when the oil painting, criticised by Mr Trump as "purposefully distorted" and "truly the worst", will be replaced.

title.children: Trump's portrait removed from Colorado's state capitol

image.altText: A tank with smoke visible nearby

props.synopsis: Talks in Saudi Arabia between delegations from the United States and Russia have again failed to produce a comprehensive ceasefire between Moscow and Kyiv, although separate deals to cement an informal truce already in place in the Black Sea was signed.

title.children: Russia-Ukraine ceasefire flops again after hours of talks 'about nothing'

image.altText: Man outside a courthouse wearing a Uniting Church baseball cap.

props.synopsis: Former Marist Brother Gregory Sutton, who was named at the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse, pleads guilty to offences committed in the state's far north in the 1970s.

title.children: Marist Brother sentenced over historical offences at Qld school

image.altText: A woman smiles with arms folded and road behind her

props.synopsis: In Sydney's inner city, three former tunnelling sites remain vacant and unused. The NSW government has ruled out setting aside the lots for social housing — a decision some suggest is wrong.

title.children: 'Absolute waste': Housing crisis fuels debate over rare Sydney properties

image.altText: A photo of a blonde toddler with a flower behind one ear

props.synopsis: Two-and-a-half year old Emile Soleil mysteriously vanished from a French alpine village in 2023, with his remains discovered nine months later.

title.children: Grandparents arrested for suspected murder of French toddler

image.altText: A phone displaying a text that reads "hi Mum, it's me! Phones broken. Using this temp for now, how are you?"

props.synopsis: Three years on from when the first "Hi Mum" texts appeared on Australian mobile phones, parents are still falling for this emotive scam.

title.children: Calls to charity from 'Hi Mum' victims jump as text scam persists

image.altText: Aerial view of water and station in Queensland

props.synopsis: More heavy rainfall is forecast after a drenching in outback and north Queensland closes roads and strands inland residents.

title.children: Outback towns now 'islands' as record-breaking rain continues

image.altText: Senior Sergeant Jay Notaro in front of the water police building at the Southport Spit.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for prominent Queensland police officer Jay Notaro after his surfboard washed up on a northern NSW beach.

title.children: Missing police officer sort of person 'we should aspire to be like'

image.altText: Pope Francis on the balcony at a hospital in Rome

props.synopsis: After a breathing crisis that involved the pontiff nearly choking on his vomit, "there was a real risk he might not make it," said Sergio Alfieri, a physician at Rome's Gemelli hospital.

title.children: Pope was so ill doctors considered letting him die

image.altText: woman taking a selfie in a car

props.synopsis: Ahmad Hodroj pleads guilty to the domestic violence manslaughter of his estranged wife and mother of three Amira Moughnieh in their Sydney home.

title.children: Murder charge dropped as Sydney man pleads guilty to wife's DV manslaughter

image.altText: A SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule manoeuvres in space following undocking from the ISS to begin a journey to return to Earth.

props.synopsis: When SpaceX launches its next mission in the coming days, it will include an Australian-led experiment that could have significant ramifications for the future of space exploration.

title.children: Astronauts to grow edible mushrooms during next space mission

image.altText: Tony Popovic has his thumb up

props.synopsis: With six points out of six and an extension to Tony Popovic's unbeaten start to life as Socceroos coach, Australia is daring to dream of a stress-free passage to the 2026 FIFA World Cup. But the job is not done yet, not by a long shot.

title.children: Socceroos can dream of World Cup qualification, but not yet
